Technical requirements: Develop a technology that has specific functional requirements, such as voice recognition, text-to-speech functionality, and object detection, etc.
Ethics and privacy: Ensure that the technology respects the privacy of the user and the integrity of their personal data. This includes data storage and protection.
Design for affordability: The technology should be accessible to the visually impaired while also being affordable and sustainable.
Technical support: The technology should have adequate technical support and troubleshooting measures to ensure its continued use.
Learning curve: The technology should have a smooth learning curve, making it easy for users to understand and use effectively.
